title: Relates to charitable organizations
summary: Relates to charitable organizations; provides for a detailed statement setting forth how the percentage of funds contributed to such charitable organization are allocated according to certain criteria.

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CALHOUN, BURLING, KOLB, McDONOUGH, OAKS -- read

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to  charitable  organiza-
         tions

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of  section  172  of  the  executive  law  is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph (k) to read as follows:
    3    (K)  A  DETAILED  STATEMENT  SETTING FORTH HOW THE PERCENTAGE OF FUNDS
    4  CONTRIBUTED TO THAT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION ARE ALLOCATED TO EACH OF THE
    5  FOLLOWING: (I) ADMINISTRATIVE AND OPERATING EXPENSES,  AND  (II)  DIRECT
    6  CHARITABLE  PURPOSES CONSISTENT WITH THOSE STATED IN THAT ORGANIZATION'S
    7  REGISTRATION AS REQUIRED BY PARAGRAPH (E) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
    8    S 2. Subdivision 2 of section 172-d of the executive law,  as  amended
    9  by chapter 43 of the laws of 2002, is amended to read as follows:
   10    2.  Engage  in any fraudulent or illegal act, device, scheme, artifice
   11  to defraud or for obtaining money  or  property  by  means  of  a  false
   12  pretense,  representation  or  promise,  transaction  or  enterprise  in
   13  connection with any solicitation or with the registration, reporting and
   14  disclosure provisions of this  article,  INCLUDING  ANY  STATEMENT  THAT
   15  COULD  REASONABLY  BE  DEEMED  TO FALSELY IMPLY THAT A PROFESSIONAL FUND
   16  RAISER AS DEFINED IN THIS ARTICLE IS NOT IN  FACT  A  PROFESSIONAL  FUND
   17  RAISER  BUT  IS RATHER A MEMBER OR OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION WHICH HAS
   18  CONTRACTED WITH SUCH PROFESSIONAL  FUND  RAISER.  The  term  "fraud"  or
   19  "fraudulent"  as used herein shall include those acts which may be char-
   20  acterized as misleading or deceptive including, but not limited to those
   21  acts covered by the  term  "fraud"  or  "fraudulent"  under  subdivision
   22  twelve  of  section  sixty-three  of this chapter AND ALSO INCLUDING ANY
   23  VERBAL OR WRITTEN  STATEMENT  THAT  FALSELY  INDICATES  THAT  A  GREATER
   24  PERCENTAGE  OF  FUNDS  COLLECTED BY THE PROFESSIONAL FUND RAISER WILL BE
   25  FORWARDED TO THE ORGANIZATION WHICH HAS  CONTRACTED  WITH  SUCH  PROFES-

    4  to defraud nor injury need to be shown; or
